intro: Calamintha acinifolia, commonly known as sweet cicely, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in umbel-shaped clusters. Its roots and seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a spice due to their aromatic properties. Calamintha acinifolia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun.
